For this exercise, we need to calculate the following financial ratios for Smolira Golf Corp at the end of 2018:

- Price-earnings ratio
- Dividends per Share
- Market-to-book ratio
- PEG

We know the following information:

|||
|--|--|
Issued Common Stocks	|20,000
Stock Price	|$58 
Growth	|9%

First, we will are going to calculate the Price-earnings ratio (PE ratio). This ratio is used to measure the value investors are willing to pay per dollar of earnings.

$$ PE = \frac{\text{Price per share}}{\text{Earnings per share}}

Before we calculate the PE ratio we need to calculate the Earnings per Share (EPS). This ratio is used to calculate how much a firm produces or earns per share. 

*We use the Net Income which is provided in the Income Statement.*

$$\begin{aligned}
EPS & = \frac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Number of Shares}}\\
\\
& =\frac{\$62,235 }{20,000}\\
& =\boxed{\$3.11}
\end{aligned}$$

EPS is **$3.11**.

Now we can compute the PE ratio. 
$$\begin{aligned}
PE 
& =\frac{\$58}{\$3.11}\\
& =\boxed{18.64}
\end{aligned}$$

The PE ratio for this company is **18.64**

The next step is to calculate the Dividends per Share. This ratio, as the name suggests, lets us know how much dividend an investor obtains per share owned. 

*We use the Dividends which is provided in the Income Statement.*


$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Dividends per Share} & = \frac{\text{Dividends}}{\text{Number of Shares}}\\
\\
& =\frac{\$25,000 }{20,000}\\
& =\boxed{\$1.25}
\end{aligned}$$

Dividends per Share for this company are **$1.25**

Next, we are going to calculate Market-to-book ratio. This ratio compares the market value of a stock to its book value. If this ratio is less than 1 it suggests that the firm is not successfully creating value for the investors. 

$$ \text{Market-to-book ratio} = \frac{\text{Stock Price}}{\text{Stock's Book Value}}

Before we calculate the Market-to-book ratio we need to calculate the Stock's Book Value. 

*We use the Total Equity which is provided in the Balance Sheet.*

$$\begin{aligned}
 \text{Stock's Book Value} & = \frac{\text{Total Equity}}{\text{Number of Shares}}\\
\\
& =\frac{\$399,452}{20,000}\\
& =\boxed{\$19.97 }
\end{aligned}$$

Stock's Book Value is **$19.97**.

Finally, we can calculate the PEG ratio. This ratio is used to value a stock whilst taking into account expected growth during a period of time. 
$$\begin{aligned}
PEG & = \frac{PE}{\text{Growth}}\\
\\
& =\frac{18.64}{\text{9}}\\
& =\boxed{2.07}
\end{aligned}$$

The PEG ratio for the company is **2.07**
